content:
{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-332-05-A
|Item_parent=Shock. Main aetiologies: hypovolaemic, septic (see item 158), cardiogenic, anaphylactic.
|Item_parent_short=Shock. Main aetiologies: hypovolaemic, septic (see item 158), cardiogenic, anaphylactic.
|Rank=A
|Title=Know the elements of the anamnesis and the clinic for the aetiological diagnosis according to the anamnesis and the clinic.
|Description=Know how to collect the anamnestic and clinical elements necessary for diagnostic orientation
|Rubric=Positive diagnosis
|Contributors=Julien Poissy
|Order=5}}

The elements of etiological orientation in the initial phase of the evaluation of a state of shock are above all clinical.<gallery widths="300" heights="300">
File:Algorithme enquete en étiologique état de choc.jpg
</gallery>

question.question: What are the primary elements used for diagnostic orientation in the initial phase of evaluating a state of shock?
question.option_b: Clinical elements, such as patient history and physical examination
question.option_d: Family medical history and social habits
